definition: mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point

sentences.english: Self- checking regularly is also needed for discovering and correcting error in medical records.
sentences.chinese: 进行阶段性自我检查，发现错处及时纠正。

sentences.english: It is the nature of folly to see the faults of others and forget his own.
sentences.chinese: 愚蠢的本质是只看到别人的错处而忘却了自己的过失。

sentences.english: Language originate before philosophy, and that's what's wrong with philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 语言起源于哲学以前，这就是哲学的错处。

sentences.english: I don't see anything wrong in space travel.
sentences.chinese: 我不认为空间旅行有什么错处。

sentences.english: My teacher always points out and corrects my mistakes whenever I hand in my composition .
sentences.chinese: 每次交的作文，老师总是给我指出错处并加以改正。

sentences.english: The mischief is that he did it without permission.
sentences.chinese: 错处就在他做这事末经许可。

sentences.english: Blame someone else, find someone else's mistakes, which is directly opposite and rituals.
sentences.chinese: 非难别人，找别人的错处，这和礼仪是直接对立的。

sentences.english: Mistakes were scored in red ink.
sentences.chinese: 错处用红墨水作了记号。

sentences.english: In retrospect, its easy to see why we were wrong.
sentences.chinese: 回顾过去就很容易明白我们的错处了。

sentences.english: He is a mean and nasty boss who is always finding faults with his employees.
sentences.chinese: 他是刻薄不仁的老板，经常挑雇员的错处。

definition: handle/(fig.) information that can be used against sb
a pretext for gossip/a matter for derision
to forgive easily/to let off lightly (often with negative: you won't get away with it)
to stick up for a wrongdoer
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)
to gossip and meddle/to shoot one's mouth off/talkative
